comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run the following code through the compiler var since = document.getElementById("sc"); since.value = ""; since.oninput = ParseSince; What is the expected output? a = document.getElementById("sc"); a.value = ""; a.oninput = B; What do you see instead? a = document.getElementById("sc"); a.value = ""; a.Ra = B; What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Closure Compiler (http://code.google.com/closure/compiler) Version: v20140110 Built on: 2014/01/14 16:25 Please provide any additional information below. Used these flags: --compilation_level ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS \ --language_in=ECMASCRIPT5_STRICT \
An extern patch would be welcome.  Just be sure to reference the correct documentation for the method.

Here it is.

The specific events added is documented here.
http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#events-inputevents

But since that part of the file already references http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#event-types no extra documentation was added.
Please let me know if there is anything else needed for the patch to be accepted.

Looks good to me, thanks for the contribution!

Have you signed a CLA?
https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/wiki/Contributors
Yes I had, I've also added myself to the CONTRIBUTORS with this new patch.
This issue was closed by revision 6417b898f917.
